instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message:
not sure where to look on the schematic.


i've found corrosion on pin2 of U5110 - replaced
i've found corrosion on pin8,9 of u8005. - replaced


maybe i have a dead smc?
[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/MMMJqmb.jpg[/IMG]
    [IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/oZA8toW.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message: Look at page 41 of the schematic. R5450, U5450 etc... Check all of that .. Check U5430 and its corresponding circuit as well

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message: Seen page 41 before. IC0R and PC0R is same thing?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message: Not 100% sure but schematic has nothing for PC0R so my guess is PC0R is based off of a reading from something in the IC0R circuit

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message:
R5450 is ok
R5455 is ok
R5451 is ok
U5450 is ok. has 8.58v on pin4,5. 3.3v on pin3


R54301, U5430 are non-stuff. pin3 has 3.3v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message: One of the traces from U5450 to R5450 is corroded probably.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message:
checked traces from U5450 to R5450, all good. i even have replaced both, just to be sure.

any more ideas? dead cpu?


---------------------------------


one thing i've just notice.. when i put back into the case. connect all cables and battery. It will turn on automatically every-time when i plug the magsafe.

i know 2013,2014 air, turns on automatically without a battery connected and only once when connected with a battery.

but this has known good fully charged battery and it still turns on automatically. i've tired without trackpad flex and it still does it.

please watch my video, [URL]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mdRwDpt6Y-0[/URL]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message: Voltage on both sides of R5455?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message:
R5455
-------------------
pin2 = 1.513v
pin1 = 0.132v

The corrosion was on pin2 of [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/c1-sn0903049.html"]U5110[/URL] - this was replaced which i've stated on the 1st post.



just compared with a known working board =

R5455
-------------------
pin2 = 0.130v
pin1 = 0.129v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message: Crap under the SMC is pulling up that line. Give it some flux and some heat.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message:
i've reflowed the SMC and (PC0R) have PASSED in ASD :)

Was kinda knew it was SMC but need to confirm with you before i do sometime like this..



The laptop still turn on every-time i plug in the magsafe with a fully charged battery connected any idea and even without a trackpad flex connected?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message: Did you shut it down from within OSX?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message: no, i hold the power button to turn it off.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - turns on but slow, Faulty sensor (PC0R)
threads.message:
does osx save sleep state to bios? i've just shutdown within osx, plug magsafe and it no longer turn on its own.

job done. cheers :)
